TopicTitle: VAB/launchpad hangs up and damages save when loading vessel with missing parts

Articles.Content:
Since 0.90 update I have an issue when trying to load vessels containing missing parts (before 0.90 I was doing this to find out what exactly parts are missing, so I tried it again after update):

1. Go to VAB

2. Click load ship and select any ship with missing parts, click to load it

3. Watch usual error message with list of missing parts, but after you close it:

a - almost no buttons in VAB are working, including exit and other in upper right part, except for load button

b - can't load any different vessel

c - some people reported on same issue that sometimes it's possible to just click a command pod and launch it, then revert to VAB, but I was never able to do it - when trying to launch there is an error that no info regarding ship size available

and d - after alt+f4 when returning to that save, all current contracts are gone (don't know if any other damage is also done, I've loaded backup save as soon as I found out about contract).

Doesn't happen when missing part is experimental and vessel is still listed as ok in launch list without red sign saying about missing parts.

And 2nd similar problem: - UPDATE: seems to have fixed itself O_o

1. Go to launchpad from KSC view

2. Select any valid vessel while there are some with missing parts in the list and try to launch valid one

3. Launchpad window closes and can't be open again (until you enter/exit and other building), no launch, no error messages

At the same time, valid vessels are launching ok from VAB.

Tried to remove all ship files with missing files from save folder - now valid vessels are launching from launchpad menu, but weird launch clamp bug occurs - LC's concrete base floats in the are right below its upper red part, even though they're working as if they're actually anchored to the ground. When launching same vessel in the same conditions from VAB - clamps seem to be in order.
